I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
instr: Set
data: Type
one_step: instr -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_fun: forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_dec: forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2}
P: subcode.code instr
Q: code
p: nat
st3: state
st2: state
st1: state

Goal:
out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> P // st1 -+> st2 -> Q//st1-[p]->st3 -> exists q : nat, q < p /\ Q//st2-[q]->st3

Premises:

Notation state := (nat * data)%type
fst : ?A * ?B -> ?A where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : subcode.code instr Q : code p : nat st1 : state st2 : state st3 : state |- Type] ?B : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss

VarMap.Branch : VarMap.t ?A -> ?A -> VarMap.t ?A -> VarMap.t ?A where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : subcode.code instr Q : code p : nat st1 : state st2 : state st3 : state |- Type]
EnvRing.PX : EnvRing.Pol ?C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol ?C -> EnvRing.Pol ?C where ?C : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : subcode.code instr Q : code p : nat st1 : state st2 : state st3 : state |- Type]
subcode_sss_terminates_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 ↓ -> P // st1 ↓
subcode_sss_step_inv_1 : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st1 :1> st2 -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2
subcode_sss_compute_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st3 -> P // st1 -> > st3
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
subcode_sss_subcode_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (p k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> P//st1-[p] -> st2 -> Q//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists q : nat, k = p + q /\ Q//st2-[q] -> st3
subcode_sss_compute_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> out_code (fst st3) P -> Q // st1 -> > st3 -> exists st2 : state, P // st1 -> > st2 /\ Q // st2 -> > st3 /\ out_code (fst st2) P
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_stall = fun (ii : instr) (st : state) => forall st' : state, ~ st ⟬ ii ⦒ st' : instr -> state -> Prop
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (P : code) (ii : instr) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'
subcode_sss_progress : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 -+> st2 -> Q // st1 -+> st2
subcode_sss_steps_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (k : nat) (st1 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> out_code (fst st3) P -> Q//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists (k1 k2 : nat) (st2 : state), P//st1-[k1] -> st2 /\ Q//st2-[k2] -> st3 /\ k = k1 + k2 /\ out_code (fst st2) P
subcode_sss_step_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> Q // st1 :1> st2 -> P // st1 :1> st2
subcode_out_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
subcode_sss_compute : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 -> > st2 -> Q // st1 -> > st2
subcode_sss_step : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 :1> st2 -> Q // st1 :1> st2
subcode_sss_compute_trans : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 -> > st2 -> Q // st2 -> > st3 -> Q // st1 -> > st3
sss_steps_ind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> Prop), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
sss_steps_sind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> SProp), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
sss_steps_fun : forall (P : code) (k : nat) (s t1 t2 : state), P//s-[k] -> t1 -> P//s-[k] -> t2 -> t1 = t2
in_out_code : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : subcode.code X), in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
sss_progress_trans : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 -+> st2 -> P // st2 -+> st3 -> P // st1 -+> st3

``` 
intros.
intros H1 H2 H3 H4.
destruct H1 as [k1 l1 i1 r1 d1 [H1_1 [H1_2 H1_3]]].
destruct H4 as [q [H4_1 H4_2]].
exists q.
split.
- exact H4_1.
- apply subcode_sss_subcode_inv with (p:=p) (st2:=st2) (st3:=st3) in H2; auto.
  destruct H2 as [q' [H2_1 H2_2]].
  rewrite H4_2.
  apply subcode_out_code with (Q:=Q) (i:=k1) in H2_2; auto.
  exact H2_2.
```

original: intros. intros H1 H2 H3 H4. destruct H1 as [k1 l1 i1 r1 d1 [H1_1 [H1_2 H1_3]]]. destruct H4 as [q [H4_1 H4_2]]. exists q. split. - apply H4_1. - apply subcode_sss_subcode_inv with (p:=p) (st2:=st2) (st3:=st3) in H2; auto. destruct H2 as [q' [H2_1 H2_2]]. rewrite H4_2. apply subcode_out_code with (Q:=Q) (i:=k1) in H2_2; auto. apply H2_2.
